definition: to take care of/to raise money/to attend to (guests, customers etc)
to open up/to spread/sheet of paper/classifier for flat objects, sheet/classifier for votes

sentences.english: I took this picture from the popular view in Reine, Lofoten.
sentences.chinese: 根据流行的观点我拍摄了这张罗弗敦群岛赖因的照片。

sentences.english: This not carefree just came down, their house then has yet started heeding to absences.
sentences.chinese: 这不刚闲下来了，他们家便开始张罗了。

sentences.english: Xiao Yang to celebrate the school, specially arranged a big wide a class reunion.
sentences.chinese: 为庆祝肖杨入学，大宽特意张罗了一次同学聚会。

sentences.english: She immediately started rushing around, yelling at her son to call the doctor.
sentences.chinese: 她一下子就张罗开了，呼喊着她的儿子赶忙去请医生。

sentences.english: Aunt Zhou then set about making tea.
sentences.chinese: 周大婶这时张罗着沏茶。

sentences.english: To show their gratitude, the locals prepared a feast.
sentences.chinese: 当地人为表达感激，张罗了一桌盛宴款待她们。

sentences.english: In a few hours, it would be time.
sentences.chinese: 我们才张罗了几小时，应该行了吧。

sentences.english: James is arranging a big surprising party for her.
sentences.chinese: 詹姆斯正为海伦张罗一场令她惊喜的晚会。

definition: to bribe/to get (luggage) ready/to put in order/to organize things/(baseball) RBI (run batted in)
to clear up/to tidy up/to pick up/to repair
to pool resources (for a gift, project etc)
to rush/in a hurry/to worry about being late
to hold a welcoming dinner or reception
to act in a supporting role/fig. to play second fiddle
to raise enough money to do sth/to pool money/to club together (to do sth)
